question: Who was recently appointed as the new Prime Minister of Russia?
explanation:
The entire government of Russia including the then Prime Minister Dmitry Medvedev resigned following the constitutional reforms proposed by the Russian President Vladimir Putin. Putin proposed the former bureaucrat and tax official, Mikhail Mishustin as the next Prime Minister of Russia.
The lawmakers have approved the nomination of Vladimir Putin, for the new Prime Minister. Russiaâ€™s lower house of Parliament, the State Duma voted in favour of the nominated Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin, which fetched him 383 votes out of 424.
